reviewText: I really dislike using this product. The loudness of the hardware makes me a target for disgruntled stares when I need to be moving in silence. The straps don't make it easy to move with 2 cameras attached to this thing without fear of one of them swinging into a wall or person. The design is not thoughtful of anyone who wants to actually have any sort of mobility while wearing this. I wouldn't buy this again. And I would return it, if I could.
reviewTime: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023

reviewText: I'm a videographer but am venturing slowly into photography. I normally only use one camera while I' filming but needed something more for when I'm photographing. I didn't want to spend hundreds of dollars on a harness that wouldn't be used that often so I went with a cheaper option but this didn't disappoint. I'm not upset about the plastic feel of the leather at all and it does what I need when I need it. Couldn't ask for much more then that. I'm happy with it so far.
reviewTime: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2023

reviewText: This was a good fit and although some of the "leather" parts seemed really cheap and thin it's held out. If you are going to use this with the intent of not unhooking the camera/s during your shoot this'll work. But if you intend to remove the camera (e.g. for extreme angles, etc.) keep looking. The sleeve that screws in and out to tighten and loosen has to be loosened just right, not too far, or it won't open to release the camera. A bit frustrating if you remove the camera a lot.
reviewTime: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
